properties.areaDesc: Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued February 6 at 3:40AM PST until February 7 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton OR
properties.description:
...Moderate to heavy rain and snowmelt to cause rapid rises on
creeks and streams through Friday morning...

the Flood Watch continues for

* portions of northeast Oregon and southeast Washington,
including the following areas, in northeast Oregon, Foothills
of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon. In southeast
Washington, Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington.

* Through Friday morning

* Periods of moderate to heavy rainfall through early Friday. The
rain combined with snowmelt will cause significant rises on
rivers and streams with some flooding possible on smaller
streams and creeks draining out of the Blue Mountains.

* At this time, the area expected to be most affected is the
headwaters of the Umatilla river at and above Gibbon since it
responds quickly to excessive rainfall.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

Latest river forecasts available at
water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pdt.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING
